basics.name: Abd Alsattar Ardati
basics.label: Lecturer | Social Entrepreneur | Wikimedia UK Trainer
basics.summary: I'm a Lecturer at the University of St Andrews School of Computer Science. I have recently wrapped up my PhD in Computer Science, with graduation just around the corner! My research led to the introduction of an Ethnographically-informed Distributed Participatory Design (EDPD) framework. This framework provides a novel process for involving diverse, widely distributed online communities in building grassroots solutions. Presently, my focus is on exploring participatory design strategies that foster stronger connections between researchers and communities, enabling us to tackle persistent social issues like digital poverty.

work.position: Postgraduate Academic Convenor & St Leonard's Liaison Officer
highlights: As a Postgraduate Academic Convenor, I was responsible for the academic representation of Postgraduates. My primary responsibility for the Students' Union is to represent the PG community's views at the University committee level for Taught and Research Students.
I worked alongside the Postgraduate President and numerous other excellent team members to provide union-side support (academic or otherwise), events, and balls for the Postgraduate community.

My role as a St Leonard's Liaison Officer was to work with St Leonard's College, the 'home' for all postgraduates within the university, and the Graduate School regarding the postgraduate student experience.

The role involved convening meetings between Postgraduate Committee members, the Provost, the St Leonard's College Administrative Officer, and other St Leonard's College management. I also worked alongside university staff members to arrange the St Leonard's College dinner, which happens once a semester
